title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Minimum import price for APIs to hit small pharma
items.author: Teena Thacker, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The government is weighing minimum import prices for Penicillin-G, 6APA and amoxicillin, potentially raising *API* and medicine costs.
- Over 10,000 *MSMEs* could be affected, risking about 200,000 jobs.
- Experts see it as a push toward *self-reliance* amid *China*’s dominance, though critics say *PLI* wasn’t meant to regulate these prices.

items.title: Tech, electronics firms back codes, but worry about costs
New labour codes: What they mean for workers and businesses
items.summary:
- The four codes unify *wages*, *industrial relations*, *social security* and *safety* under one framework, extending social protection to *gig workers*.
- Small firms gain flexibility as layoffs threshold rises to 300, with daily hours capped at 8–12 and **double overtime**.
- Other reforms include a **wage floor**, **26 weeks of maternity leave**, night work safeguards, formal employment letters, and a five-year nationwide contractor license.

items.title: UK to levy $655 million of new tariffs on low-value imports
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- **Reeves** plans to remove the tariff exemption for *low-value imports* costing under £135, aiming to raise about £500 million annually. 
- The government says any impact on *consumer prices* will be modest, while critics warn it could affect online shoppers and aid **British retailers**. 
- The move echoes actions in the US and EU to close loopholes on cross-border shopping.

items.title: From dependence to dominance: India’s next test in solar manufacturing
MoS suspends QCO enforcement on 42+13 steel standards
items.summary:
- The *Ministry of Steel* suspended enforcement of the **Quality Control Order (QCO)** on 42 Indian Standards for three years to keep downstream availability.
- Enforcement on 13 *speciality steel standards* was suspended for one year to balance pricing, imports, and support for *MSMEs* and domestic self-reliance.
- The changes were issued via the **Steel and Steel Products (Quality Control) Amendment Order, 2025**.

items.title: Delhi govt to begin annual survey of industries to assess manufacturing sector growth
AstraZeneca to invest $2 billion as part of US manufacturing push
items.summary:
- **AstraZeneca** will invest $2 billion to boost **US manufacturing** and build a new clinical manufacturing facility in **Gaithersburg, MD** that will be operational by 2029.
- The **Gaithersburg** facility will create 100 new jobs, retain 400 roles and support about 1,000 construction jobs.
- Earlier announcements include a **Rockville, Maryland** cell therapy facility, a **Virginia** drug substance facility, and the expansion of the **Coppell, Texas** site as part of the US manufacturing push.

items.title: Servotech wins ₹16.31-cr REMCL solar order
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- **Servotech Renewable Power System** won a contract worth **₹16.31 crore** from **REMCL** to design, supply and commission solar power systems at the Dedicated Freight Corridor complex in **Noida**.
- The scope includes **ground-mounted** and **rooftop on-grid solar plants** with a **12-month** timeline, and the order carries no related-party transactions.
- **REMCL** is a JV between **RITES** and the Ministry of Railways, underscoring growing railway-linked clean-energy projects.

items.title: World's biggest nuclear plant edges closer to restart
NTPC, Power Grid emerge as top picks in renewable energy sector: Mayuresh Joshi
Air cargo links India-Afghanistan to start soon
items.summary:
- The **Kabul-Delhi** and **Kabul-Amritsar** air freight corridors have been activated and cargo flights will commence soon.
- A trade attache will be deployed in each embassy and the joint working group on trade, commerce and investment will be reactivated to boost bilateral trade.
- Bilateral trade is around **$1 billion** with growth potential as ties expand.

items.title: Skilled workforce vital for India's stainless steel growth
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- Jindal Stainless aims to train **5 lakh** MSME fabricators in coming years to meet rising demand.
- Stainless Academy has educated over **60,000** people and aligns with *Make in India* and *Skill India* to build a future-ready workforce.
- The stainless steel sector is growing at about **9% CAGR** and will expand across sectors, underscoring the need for skilled workers.

items.title: Mumbai BMC to shut sites if AQI stays over 200
items.summary:
- *BMC* warned industrial units and construction could be shut if AQI stays above 200 even after mitigation, under **GRAP-4**.
- Flying squads of engineers and police will monitor compliance, check air sensors and curb waste burning.
- Measures include cleaner fuels, misting systems, and better debris handling to curb dust.

items.title: Steel sector needs more R&D, AI for growth: Kumaraswamy
items.summary:
- H D Kumaraswamy urged greater *R&D* investment and adoption of *AI*, *machine learning*, and *digitalization* to boost the steel sector's growth and competitiveness in India.
- The Odisha event showcased tech‑driven innovation and collaboration among stakeholders to upgrade infrastructure and expand capacity, aiming for higher efficiency with *in‑house talent*.
- He called for sustained *R&D* funding and stronger private sector participation alongside CPSEs to drive modernization and best‑practice sharing.

items.title: Verizon to lay off 13,000 as telco reorients
items.summary:
- *Verizon* is cutting more than 13,000 jobs as part of a strategic reorientation under CEO *Dan Schulman* to simplify operations and boost customer focus.
- The cuts, about 20% of management, come as the company faces cost pressures and competition from AT&T and T-Mobile.
- *Reuters* notes potential cuts up to 15,000; in Q3 2025, *Verizon* earned $4.95B on $33.82B revenue, with prepaid gains but a net loss of postpaid connections.

items.title: European arms makers retreat as peace plan gains traction
items.summary:
- European *defence* stocks slid after reports of a U.S.-backed peace plan, dragging the sector lower.
- Analysts warned the plan could spur higher *defence* spending and risk a de facto victory for *Russia* if imposed, while *Ukraine* and its allies remained skeptical.
- Shares in Rheinmetall, Leonardo, Saab, TKMS and Indra moved as traders weighed headlines against fundamentals.

items.title: Paints Industry may see 8-10% demand growth in march qtr
items.author: Nikita Periwal
items.summary:
- *The domestic paints sector is expected to grow **8-10%** in the March quarter, driven by pent-up demand after the monsoon, with **Birla Opus**’ impact minimised.
- **Birla Opus** has entered with two-fifths of capacity; the **JSW Paints**-**Akzo Nobel India** deal is unlikely to alter on-ground dynamics, and growth is seen returning to *4-5%* this quarter; the initial trauma is easing.
- The broader context shows the ~₹75,000-crore decorative paints market had double-digit growth for years, underscoring the value of specialization and ground-level reach over conglomerate size.

items.title: Tata Power to build 1,125 MW Bhutan hydro project
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary: - Tata Power signs agreements with *DGPC* to develop the 1,125 MW *Dorjilung Hydroelectric Power Project* in *Bhutan*, via a SPV with *DGPC* 60% and Tata Power 40%.\n- The ₹13,100 crore, run‑of‑the‑river project on the *Kurichhu River* is *Bhutan’s largest PPP hydro project*, aiming for commissioning by 2031 with about 80% of power to *India*.\n- The alliance targets about 5,000 MW of *clean energy* in *Bhutan* and deeper regional energy security, backed by the *World Bank*.

items.title: JTL Industries completes ₹46.5-crore payment to acquire RCI Industries
items.summary:
- JTL Industries completed full payment of **₹46.5 crore** for the acquisition of **RCI Industries & Technologies**, marking a step forward in the **NCLT**-approved resolution process. 
- Following the payment, the Monitoring Committee reinstated the **Board of Directors** and transferred management to **JTL Industries**, signaling the concluding phase of the acquisition. 
- The deal launches **copper products** expansion, helping **JTL Industries** become a **multi-material solutions provider** and drive synergies across its value chain.

items.title: Jyoti CNC begins operations at expanded facility in France
items.summary:
- Jyoti CNC Automation said it has commenced operations at the expanded facility of its wholly-owned subsidiary *Huron Graffenstaden* in *Strasbourg*, *France*. 
- The expansion *doubles* capacity and positions Jyoti to meet rising demand from the *aerospace sector* and serve *global customers*. 
- This milestone aligns with Jyoti's growth strategy and strengthens its *European manufacturing footprint*.

items.title: India's HSBC flash PMI falls to six-month low at 59.9 in Nov from 60.4 in Oct
New cathode tech could make zinc-ion batteries a gamechanger
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary: - The Ministry reports a *cathode material* for *Zn-ion batteries* activated by a *thermo-electrochemical process* delivering higher *energy density* and longer life for *energy storage*.\n- Researchers convert *vanadium oxide* into a *zinc-vanadium oxide* structure via heat and electricity, highlighting ZIBs as safer, greener alternatives to lithium-ion.\n- The work by the Centre for Nano and Soft Matter Sciences, Bengaluru, published in *Advanced Energy Materials*, could impact grid-scale storage and renewable energy integration.

items.title: OpenAI and Foxconn Partner in US AI Hardware
items.summary:
- **OpenAI** and **Foxconn** will co-design and manufacture AI data centre racks and related hardware in US facilities, aiming to bolster US AI infrastructure.
- The initial products include cabling, networking and power systems, with **OpenAI** having early access to evaluate and possibly buy them, with no upfront financial commitments.
- The partnership aligns with Foxconn's diversification and reinforces **Sam Altman's** view that critical AI tech should be built in the US, boosting leadership in AI.

items.title: Moody's: India's growth at 7% in 2025, 6.4% in 2026
items.summary:
- Moody's projects India's *GDP growth* at **7%** in 2025 and **6.4%** in 2026, supported by strong *domestic demand* amid global uncertainty.
- It notes that *India* and *Australia* will lead growth among emerging and advanced markets on robust domestic consumption, with the APAC outlook remaining stable for 2026.
- Across the APAC region, GDP growth is expected to be steady, with emerging markets driving growth; the *rupee* weakness is noted, while Indian firms remain financially strong with solid risk management.

items.title: Hindalco reports fire at Novelis' Oswego plant
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - A *fire* at Hindalco’s Novelis *Oswego* facility on Thursday; all workers evacuated with no injuries reported.\n- Oswego, a key site contributing ~10% of output, already faced a Sept 16 fire; two incidents in under two months raise continuity concerns.\n- Hindalco estimates FY26 negative free cash flow impact of about *$550–650 million*, with ~*70–80%* recoverable via *insurance*; restart by end-*Dec 2025* and a 4–6 week ramp-up.

items.title: UK manufacturers report sharpest drop in output since August 2020
Electronics the only bright spot for exports amid a dull October
India to stay fastest-growing major economy for decades
items.author: Shantanu Nandan Sharma, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- *Goyal* says India will remain the *fastest-growing major economy* for decades, despite global volatility.
- He projects **7%** growth for the current year, citing strong macro fundamentals and the upgrade by *S&P Global Ratings*.
- He announced that India and Israel will begin negotiations for a *Free Trade Agreement* to boost trade and investment, stressing that trust remains the pillar of the partnership.

items.title: ICRA warns of consolidation in India's solar module sector
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- ICRA warns that India’s solar module manufacturing could consolidate over the next three to five years due to *overcapacity* and rapid technology shifts.
- Only about 70–75% of the ~110 GW approved capacity can adopt newer tech such as **TOPCon** and **bifacial** modules, underscoring the need for scale and *backward integration* ahead of a 2028 push into wafer/ingot.
- Global oversupply and trade pressures—slower US exports amid investigations into Chinese content and higher tariffs—could push older, module-only players out while vertically integrated manufacturers endure.

items.title: Steel Ministry extends QCO exemptions to March 2026
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- The Ministry of Steel extended exemptions from the *Quality Control Order (QCO)* for **Chapter 73 steel products** to shipments dated on or before March 31, 2026. 
- Exemptions for three **stainless steel flat product IS standards** will also extend to shipments through March 31, 2026. 
- The move aims to maintain *market availability* as domestic capacity expands to meet self-reliance goals.

items.title: US lawmakers target Chinese chipmaking gear under CHIPS Act
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- The bill would block the purchase of *Chinese chipmaking equipment* by **CHIPS Act** grant recipients for 10 years.
- It targets tools from lithography to wafer-slicing, including **ASML**, with House moves led by Obernolte and Lofgren and planned Senate action by Kelly and Blackburn in December.
- The CHIPS Act’s $39B aim to boost U.S. chip manufacturing is cited, but waivers are possible if certain tools aren’t produced domestically, and some grant money has already been converted to equity.

items.title: Delhi govt to begin annual survey of industries to assess manufacturing sector growth
Saudi Arabia, Stellantis exploring local vehicle manufacturing
items.summary:
- *Saudi Arabia* teams up with **Stellantis** and **Petromin** to study local vehicle manufacturing under *Vision 2030*. 
- An MoU with the Ministry of Investment and **NIDC** aims to localize both commercial and passenger vehicle production. 
- The move was announced at a Washington investment forum with Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, signaling stronger Gulf investments.

items.title: Foxconn, OpenAI partner on AI hardware manufacturing
items.summary:
- **Foxconn** and **OpenAI** will design and manufacture **data center** racks and other **AI hardware** in the **U.S.**, gaining early insight into compute needs.
- The deal has no binding purchases; **OpenAI** will have early access to evaluate systems and an option to buy.
- The collaboration expands **Foxconn**'s role in **AI infrastructure** and aligns with broader moves in AI hardware development.

items.title: Tembo wins ₹107.05cr order from Adani
items.summary:
- *Tembo Global Industries* has secured an order worth ₹107.05 crore from *Adani Enterprises* and its group companies, to be completed over 18 months.
- The contract covers engineering mechanics, design load calculations, drawings, specifications, supply and project execution across sectors including oil and gas, chemicals, construction, power, shipbuilding, nuclear power, HVAC and other installations.
- Managing Director Sanjay J Patel says the order underscores *Tembo's engineering and execution capabilities* and will support its broader expansion into *infrastructure projects* and related services.

items.title: Miners' industry body seeks rise in customs duty on aluminium imports to 15%
GE Aerospace to invest $14M at Pune facility
items.summary: - GE Aerospace will invest $14M at its *Pune facility* to boost capacity and upgrade automation for **advanced engine components**, reinforcing the **Make in India** initiative.\n- The site is *ISO 14001* and *ISO 45001* certified, with **300+ suppliers** and more than **5,000 trained associates**, reflecting sustainability and broad aerospace capability.\n- GE’s Pune operations use the **FLIGHT DECK** lean model to raise efficiency and support India’s growing role in global aerospace manufacturing, aligned with the **Make in India** program.

items.title: Kamdhenu Paints opens new depot in Mayapuri to strengthen supply network in Delhi NCR
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Kamdhenu Paints* opened a new depot in *Mayapuri* to strengthen supply and improve last-mile service for distributors and customers across *Delhi NCR*.
- A showroom-cum-experience centre in *Kirti Nagar* will showcase *decorative paints* and *wood coatings* with on-site demos for architects and designers.
- The expansion, backed by investments in *logistics* and *technical support*, aims to deepen market presence and ensure end-users have access to the right products.

items.title: This homegrown startup bets on AI-led video analytics to drive industrial automation
Eight core industries flat in Oct; fertilisers, steel up
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- The Oct 2025 core index was flat YoY, with fertilisers *+7.4%*, steel *+6.7%*, cement *+5.3%*, and refinery products *+4.6%*, as eight core industries account for about *40%* of IIP. 
- Coal, natural gas, crude oil and electricity contracted, dragging momentum: coal *-8.5%*, natural gas *-5%*, crude oil *-1.2%*, electricity *-7.6%*. 
- April–October 2025–26 growth stood at *2.5% (provisional)*; steel *+10.3%*, cement *+7.3%*, fertilisers *+0.7%*, refinery products *+0.4%* in that period, with September 2025 revised to *3.3%*.

items.title: SARAL SIMS rolls out to ease steel import regs for MSMEs
items.summary:
- *SARAL SIMS* enables a yearly registration with a single number for all steel imports in that year, letting importers file multiple consignments under one registration.
- For small imports, there is an annual cap (500 MT until April 2026, then 1,000 MT from 2026-27) and exports under Advance Authorization/SEZ/EOU have no threshold; if cap is exceeded, regular SIMS applies. *MSMEs*
- The registration process is simplified: fields reduced from 56 to 20, and clarifications/NOC for non-QCO grades are removed, with generation via the SARAL SIMS portal at sims.steel.gov.in/SARAL.

items.title: EV boom, modular manufacturing drives cold-roll form demand
items.summary:
- The *EV* boom, modular infrastructure, and demand for *precision manufacturing* are fueling a surge in sheet-metal *cold-roll forming*. 
- *Cold-roll forming* offers higher coil utilization, lower waste, and faster assembly across sectors like renewable energy, mobility, construction equipment, and elevators. 
- Industry expects the trend to boost *Make in India* and *Atmanirbhar Bharat*, expanding domestic and export supply chains for high-precision metal components.

items.title: Centre to host Bharat Steel-2026 Summit
items.author: TNN
items.summary:
- Bharat Steel-2026 is a *two-day expo* in *New Delhi* on *April 16–17, 2026* to showcase mega steel projects in states like *Odisha*, *Jharkhand*, and others.
- *Odisha* aims to be the steel capital, targeting *130 MTPA by 2030* and contributing a large share of output.
- The summit will bring together producers, policymakers, investors and lenders to discuss *global trends*, *raw-material security*, and *green steel* with a focus on *co-developing mega projects*.

items.title: MAN Industries, Aramco sign 5-year MoU for Saudi steel pipe
items.summary:
- The MoU between MAN Industries (India) and Aramco Asia India is effective for five years and aims to explore setting up a *steel pipe facility* in *Saudi Arabia* via MAN or its subsidiaries.
- The partners will collaborate to develop capabilities, technologies and resources to support energy, infrastructure and industrial needs in the *GCC* and wider Middle East.
- MAN Industries highlights its proven track record of delivering *high-quality line pipe solutions* to major energy projects.

items.title: Hiring momentum rises 5.5% in manufacturing, engineering and infrastructure: Report
In the age of electronics, General Instruments shows why the mechanical core still counts
Jeh Aerospace opens Hyderabad Mach 2 facility
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- *Mach 2* facility spans about 200,000 sq ft in *Horizon Industrial Park* near Kothur, expanding Jeh Aerospace’s Hyderabad footprint to over 250,000 sq ft.
- It will be operational in 2026 and will use *autonomous machining*, *digital twins*, and *closed-loop quality systems* for a software-defined aerospace manufacturing site.
- Jeh Aerospace founder and CEO Vishal Sanghavi calls the expansion a foundation for a new manufacturing paradigm at the intersection of *Talent*, *Technology*, and *Transformation*.

items.title: India to match global chipmaking leaders by 2032: Ashwini Vaishnaw
Nvidia CEO rejects AI bubble fears as profits soar
items.author: ETEnterpriseAI Desk
items.summary:
- Nvidia posted $31.9B in profit and $57B in quarterly revenue, up ~60% YoY, driven mainly by *data-centre GPUs*, including $50M in H-20 GPUs for China.
- CEO Jensen Huang rejected AI‑bubble fears, saying demand for GPUs signals a *long-term upgrade cycle* and AI will spawn new software categories and **agentic AI**.
- Nvidia’s valuation tops **$4.5T** as it positions for sustained AI infrastructure growth, with next-quarter revenue guided around ₹65B (~$3B) above estimates.
